I thought it was totally fine, then I realized it's most beneficial for the most anti-fun opponents.

People like Kat and Leblanc can buy it for both crazy burst and insane poke.  (Their poke becomes assassination material, actually.)

And then try facing a Nidalee with Luden's.  10 spears miss, one hits and there goes 2/3rds of your Hp.  It perfectly accomodates her sort of, "I can't land a skillshot, so I'll just spam until I eventually land one lucky shot" playstyle.

No offense to Nidalee players...not that she can't be played skillfully, just that it's too easy to do well with her, because missing your spears costs very little...and Luden's only exacerbates this issue by making that _one_ skillshot she lands every once in awhile become "nuclear-tipped" again.

DC is mathematically superior to Luden's echo in burst at virtually all AP levels and on virtually every AP champion.
If you want burst, you get DC.

However, Luden's echo provides a huge jump to poke and waveclear for single spells. DC can't compete with that.

So if you have that one spell that you use for poke, Ludens will augment it. If you're trying to get burst so you can one shot that bruiser _you don't get luden's, you get DC_. Seriously, you can do the math. The inequality is:

DC is better than Ludens if:
AP > 100/(0.3*APratio_sum-0.15)

If you're Corki, and poking with R, it's amazing. If you're Leblanc and trying to deal a single target burst pick, it's shit. DC gives more damage across the whole combo at just 108 AP. The only reason you would get it on LB would be for the waveclear because the break point is 835 AP. That's it. For Nid, it's great because she pokes people down with Q, and while it has a great AP ratio in and of itself, it's not enough to grab DC over Ludens until about 475 AP.

Luden's Echo almost never about burst; it's for poke and waveclear. Even on someone who builds a shit ton of AP but has shitty ratios like Lulu!, after only 2 basic attacks on top of EQ, _you more burst with DC_.


This is all completely moot when you have both Ludens AND DC because by getting Luden's early, you have superior poke and waveclear.

I agree. I find Luden's far more obnoxious than DFG ever was, at least the DFG I saw in season 4, since that's when I started playing. At least with DFG, the enemy had to be decently close to me to use it, and they still had to remember to use it and you could only use it every so often because of it's coolown. Ludens has none of those flaws; any spell will proc is regardless of range, whether it's a Nidalee spear, Katarina Q, or even a Ziggs or Xerath ult. It requires no extra imput to use, so it's basically some extra poke or burst that happens pretty regularly, since it actually charges pretty quickly. What's worse is that not only does it serve to make poke champions like Nidalee, Xerath, and Ziggs do even more damage, Luden's also gives quite a bit of MS as well, so good luck actually managing to close the distance on them.

Dfg can only be used once every 90 seconds and had a short range. Ludens can proc multiple times in a fight and can usually be used every time you want to use a rotation. On champs with spam abilities its even stronger. It also has the same max range as the max range of your spells so its super frustrating on poke champions + it gives waveclear. Replacing a stupid item because its being abused with an even worse stupid item that's being abused, is dumb. On the subject of stupid items they removed dfg because it "lacks counterplay", meanwhile Zhonyas still has the ability to negate entire champions kits if used correctly.
Way to reward pussy play and champs that support that playstyle even more. Ziggs, Nidalee. Xerath, etc...
